p: In line with these results, quality-of-life perception suggested trends toward symptomatic benefit. The SF-12 survey showed an improvement of the PCS throughout the follow-up period ( p = 0.02) with a significant difference in the PCS at 12 months with respect to baseline ( p ≤ 0.05). Both SF-12 MCS and MLHFQ total score did not change significantly during the follow-up period (Table 4).
